document.heading: Genetic Tests for the Establishment of Paternity Amendment Act of 1990

history.narrative: Law 8-126, the “Genetic Tests for the Establishment of Paternity Amendment Act of 1990,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 8-336, which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on February 13, 1990, and February 27, 1990, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on March 15, 1990, it was assigned Act No. 8-179 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review.

LAW 8 AN ACT ACT 8 1 9 Codification, District of Columbia Code (1991 Supplement) IN THE COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA MAR_IS,1990 To amend Title 16 of the District of Columbia Code to require a person to submit to a genetic test if requested by a party and to clarify that a genetic test must be admitted into evidence even if a party objects to the introduction, unless the objection is a substantial one. BE IT ENACTED BY THE COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, That this act may be cited as the "Genetic Tests for the Establishment of Paternity Amendment Act of 1990 Sec. 2. Title 16 of the District of Columbia Code is amended as follows a) Section 16-2343(a)(I) is amended by striking the phrase "or on the motion of a party; may require" and inserting the phrase may require or on the motion of a party, shall require" in its place; and (b) Section 16-2343.1(a) is amended as follows I) Paragraph (I) is amended by striking the phrase "Test results or expert reports showing" and inserting the phrase "Expert reports that show" in its place; and (2) A new paragraph (3) is added to read as follows 3) Test results that show the statistical probability of the alleged parent’s paternity shall be admitted into evidence unless a substantiated objection is made that the test did not comply with the requirements of this subchapter Sec. 3.
